messages.name: IMC
messages.description:
This document describes the communications protocol associated with the LSTS software framework. Concepts such as *message*, *field* and *packet* are explained in detail in the subsequent chapters.
Inter module communication is achieved by the exchange of messages that can be recognized and interpreted by all participating modules. A message is a self-contained collection of data fields conveying relevant information about a given subject. The mean by which the messages are exchanged is not described in this document, but the reader can assume that at least the UDP Internet protocol is available at all ends of the communications channel.
The Neptus Command and Control Unit (CCU), currently being used at LSTS, supports mission planning and control, using the described messaging API. This software entity can be used to define a plan before execution and monitor the plan's execution by presenting an operating console. For further details on this software contact the LSTS.
A CCU exercises authority over a vehicle (real or simulated). Usually this term is applied to software in the class of LSTS Neptus, but can also be applied to software modules extending the vehicle core control software.
The LSTS reserves itself the right to use message identification numbers up to 999. Thus if a third party needs to extend this API it must use identification numbers starting at 1000. The identification number 65535 has a special meaning and must not be used to extend the IMC protocol.

message.name: CPU Usage
message.description: Report of software CPU usage.

field.name: Usage percentage
field.description: The CPU usage, in percentage, of the sending software.

message.name: Simulated State
message.description: This message presents the simulated state of the vehicle. The simulated state attempts to provide a realistic state interpretation of operating various kinds of vehicles.

field.name: Latitude (WGS-84)
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude.

field.name: Longitude (WGS-84)
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude.

field.name: Height (WGS-84)
field.description: Height above the WGS-84 ellipsoid.

field.name: Offset north (m)
field.description: The North offset of the North/East/Down field.

field.name: Offset east (m)
field.description: The East offset of the North/East/Down field.

field.name: Offset down (m)
field.description: The Down offset of the North/East/Down field.

field.name: Rotation over x axis
field.description: The phi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over y axis
field.description: The theta Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over z axis
field.description: The psi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Body-Fixed xx Linear Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame xx axis linear velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed yy Linear Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame yy axis linear velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed zz Linear Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame zz axis linear velocity component.

field.name: Angular Velocity in x
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed xx axis (roll rate).

field.name: Angular Velocity in y
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed yy axis (pitch rate).

field.name: Angular Velocity in z
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed zz axis (yaw rate).

field.name: Stream Velocity X (North)
field.description: Stream Velocity xx axis velocity component.

field.name: Stream Velocity Y (East)
field.description: Stream Velocity yy axis velocity component.

field.name: Stream Velocity Z (Down)
field.description: Stream Velocity zz axis velocity component.

message.name: Set Thruster Actuation
message.description: Actuate directly on a thruster.

field.name: Thruster Number
field.description: The identification number of the destination thruster.

field.name: Actuation Value
field.description: Actuation magnitude.

message.name: Set Servo Position
message.description: Set the position of a servo.

field.name: Identifier
field.description: The identification number of the destination servo.

field.name: Position
field.description: Actuation magnitude.

message.name: Remote Actions Request
message.description: This message is used as query to request for the possible remote actions (operation=QUERY and the list is empty in this case). The vehicle responds using the same message type returning the tuplelist with the pairs: Action,Type (operation=REPORT). The type of action can be Axis, Hat or Button.

field.name: operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

field.name: Actions
field.description: Example: "Propulsion=Axis,PanTilt=Hat,Lights=Button"

message.name: Remote Actions
message.description: This message is used to send a periodic update of values for each remote action. If the action is not on the list the assumed value is 0.

field.name: Actions
field.description: List of values for each remote action (e.g: "Propeller=0.6,PanTilt=0.75,Lights=1").

message.name: Button Event
message.description: Event of a specific hardware button.

field.name: Button
field.description: Button identifier.

field.name: Value
field.description: Value of the button.

message.name: LCD Control
message.description: Control LCD.

field.name: Operation
field.description: The LCD action to perform

field.name: Text
field.description: Text to be written (if defined write operation).

message.name: Power Operation
message.description: This message allows controlling the system's power lines.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Operation type.

value.name: Power Down
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power down it's devices immediately. If the destination entity is the special entity '0' the whole system will power down.

value.name: Power Down in Progress
value.description: The latest power down request is in progress and the time remaining until power down is given in field 'time_remain'.

value.name: Power Down Aborted
value.description: The latest power down request was aborted.

value.name: Schedule Power Down
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power down it's devices at the time given in the field 'sched_time'. If the destination entity is the special entity '0' the whole system will power down.

value.name: Power Up
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power up it's devices.

value.name: Power Up in Progress
value.description: The latest power up request is in progress.

value.name: Schedule Power Up
value.description: Request the destination entity of this message to power up it's devices at the time given in the field 'sched_time'. If the destination entity is the special entity '0' the whole system will power up.

field.name: Time Remaining
field.description: Time remaining to complete operation.

field.name: Scheduled Time
field.description: Scheduled time of operation.

message.name: Power Channel Control
message.description: This message allows controlling power channels.

field.name: Channel Name
field.description: The name of the power channel.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

value.name: Turn Off
value.description: Turn off power channel specified in field 'id'.

value.name: Turn On
value.description: Turn on power channel specified in field 'id'.

value.name: Toggle
value.description: Toggle power channel specified in field 'id'.

value.name: Schedule Turn On
value.description: Turn on power channel specified in field 'id' in 'sched_time' seconds.

value.name: Schedule Turn Off
value.description: Turn off power channel specified in field 'id' in 'sched_time' seconds.

value.name: Reset Schedules
value.description: Reset all scheduled operations for the channel specified in field 'id'.

value.name: Save Current State
value.description: Save the current state of the channel 'id' to persistent storage.

field.name: Scheduled Time
field.description: Scheduled time of operation.

message.name: Query Power Channel State
message.description: Request the state of power channels.

message.name: Power Channel State
message.description: Message conveying the state of a power channel.

field.name: Name
field.description: Power Channel Name.

field.name: State
field.description: State of the Power Channel.

value.name: Off
value.description: Power channel is off.

value.name: On
value.description: Power channel is on.

message.name: LED Brightness
message.description: Brightness value of an LED (Light-Emitting Diode).

field.name: Name
field.description: LED name.

field.name: Value
field.description: Brightness value.

message.name: Query LED Brightness
message.description: Query the brightness of an LED (Light-Emitting Diode). The recipient of this message shall reply with 'LedBrightness'.

field.name: Name
field.description: LED name.

message.name: Set LED Brightness
message.description: Control the brightness of an LED (Light-Emitting Diode). The recipient of this message shall set the intensity of the LED to the desired 'value' and reply with 'LedBrightness'.

field.name: Name
field.description: LED name.

field.name: Value
field.description: Desired brightness value.

message.name: Estimated State
message.description:
This message presents the estimated state of the vehicle.
EstimatedState is a complete description of the system in terms of parameters such as position, orientation and velocities at a particular moment in time.
The system position is given by a North-East-Down (NED) local tangent plane displacement (x, y, z) relative to an absolute WGS-84 coordinate (latitude, longitude, height above ellipsoid).
The symbols for position and attitude as well as linear and angular velocities were chosen according to SNAME's notation (1950). The body-fixed reference frame and Euler angles are depicted next:
.. figure:: ../images/euler-lauv.png :align: center
Euler angles

field.name: Latitude (WGS-84)
field.description: WGS-84 Latitude.

field.name: Longitude (WGS-84)
field.description: WGS-84 Longitude.

field.name: Height (WGS-84)
field.description: Height above the WGS-84 ellipsoid.

field.name: Offset north
field.description: The North offset of the North/East/Down field with respect to LLH.

field.name: Offset east
field.description: The East offset of the North/East/Down field with respect to LLH.

field.name: Offset down
field.description: The Down offset of the North/East/Down field with respect to LLH.

field.name: Rotation over x axis
field.description: The phi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over y axis
field.description: The theta Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Rotation over z axis
field.description: The psi Euler angle from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Body-Fixed xx Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame xx axis velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed yy Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame yy axis velocity component.

field.name: Body-Fixed zz Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame zz axis velocity component.

field.name: Ground Velocity X (North)
field.description: Ground Velocity xx axis velocity component.

field.name: Ground Velocity Y (East)
field.description: Ground Velocity yy axis velocity component.

field.name: Ground Velocity Z (Down)
field.description: Ground Velocity zz axis velocity component.

field.name: Angular Velocity in x
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed xx axis (roll).

field.name: Angular Velocity in y
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed yy axis (pitch).

field.name: Angular Velocity in z
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed zz axis (yaw).

field.name: Depth
field.description: Depth, in meters. To be used by underwater vehicles. Negative values denote invalid estimates.

field.name: Altitude
field.description: Altitude, in meters. Negative values denote invalid estimates.

message.name: Estimated Stream Velocity
message.description: The estimated stream velocity, typically for water or air streams.

field.name: X component (North)
field.description: X component (North).

field.name: Y component (East)
field.description: Y component (East).

field.name: Z component (Down)
field.description: Z component (Down).

message.name: Navigation Uncertainty
message.description: Report of navigation uncertainty. This is usually given by the output of the state covariance matrix of an Extended Kalman Filter.

field.name: Variance - x Position
field.description: The North offset variance of the North/East/Down field with respect to LLH.

field.name: Variance - y Position
field.description: The East offset variance of the North/East/Down field with respect to LLH.

field.name: Variance - z Position
field.description: The Down offset variance of the North/East/Down field with respect to LLH.

field.name: Variance - Roll
field.description: The phi Euler angle variance from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Variance - Pitch
field.description: The theta Euler angle variance from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Variance - Yaw
field.description: The psi Euler angle variance from the vehicle's attitude.

field.name: Variance - Gyro. Roll Rate
field.description: The angular velocity variance over body-fixed xx axis (roll).

field.name: Variance - Gyro. Pitch Rate
field.description: The angular velocity variance over body-fixed yy axis (pitch).

field.name: Variance - Gyro. Yaw Rate
field.description: The angular velocity variance over body-fixed zz axis (yaw).

field.name: Variance - Body-Fixed xx Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame xx axis velocity variance component.

field.name: Variance - Body-Fixed yy Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame yy axis velocity variance component.

field.name: Variance - Body-Fixed ww Velocity
field.description: Body-fixed frame zz axis velocity variance component.

field.name: Variance - Yaw Bias
field.description: The psi Euler angle bias variance from the vehicle's sensed attitude.

field.name: Variance - Gyro. Yaw Rate Bias
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed zz axis bias variance from sensor.

message.name: Navigation Data
message.description: Report of navigation data. This is constituted by data which is not part of the vehicle estimated state but that the user may refer for more information.

field.name: Yaw Bias
field.description: The psi Euler angle bias from the vehicle's sensed attitude.

field.name: Gyro. Yaw Rate Bias
field.description: The angular velocity over body-fixed zz axis bias from sensor.

field.name: Course Over Ground
field.description: Course over ground given by NED ground velocity vectors.

field.name: Continuous Yaw
field.description: Continuous psi Euler angle (without normalizations).

field.name: GPS Rejection Filter Level
field.description: GPS rejection filter level.

field.name: LBL Rejection Filter Level
field.description: LBL rejection filter level.

field.name: Variance - Custom Variable X
field.description: Custom variable.

field.name: Variance - Custom Variable Y
field.description: Custom variable.

field.name: Variance - Custom Variable Z
field.description: Custom variable.

field.name: UTC Time of Fix
field.description: UTC time of the rejected GPS fix measured in seconds since 00:00:00 (midnight).

field.name: Reason
field.description: Reason for rejection.

value.name: Above Threshold
value.description: New GPS Fix position is above a computed threshold.

value.name: Invalid Fix
value.description: Invalid measurement.

value.name: Above Maximum HDOP
value.description: Above maximum horizontal dilution of precision.

value.name: Above Maximum HACC
value.description: Above maximum horizontal accuracy index.

value.name: Lost Validity Bit
value.description: Lost one of the validity bits between consecutive GPS fixes.

message.name: LBL Range Acceptance
message.description: When the vehicle uses Long Base Line navigation, this message notifies that a new range was received from one of the acoustics transponders. The message fields are used to identify the range value and the transponder name. Also, this message has an acceptance field that indicates whether a LBL range was accepted or rejected, and if rejected, the reason why.

field.name: Beacon Identification Number
field.description: Identification number of the acoustic transponder from which the range information was received.

field.name: Range
field.description: Distance to the acoustic transponder.

field.name: Acceptance
field.description: Reason for acceptance/rejection.

value.name: Accepted
value.description: This LBL range is accepted by the navigation filter.

value.name: Rejected - Above Threshold
value.description: New LBL Range is above a computed threshold.

value.name: Rejected - Singular Point
value.description: Singular point.

value.name: Rejected - Not Enough Information
value.description: The filter lacks information to properly use the received LBL range.

value.name: Rejected - Vehicle At Surface
value.description: Vehicle is using only GPS fix when it is at surface.

message.name: DVL Rejection
message.description: When the vehicle uses Doppler Velocity Log sensor, this message notifies that a new measurement was locally rejected by the navigation filter.

field.name: Type of velocity
field.description: This field represents the type of the rejected velocity.

field.name: Reason
field.description: Reason for rejection. There are two types of DVL measurement filters. An Innovation filter checks the innovation between the current measurement and the previous measurement within a certain amount of time and an Absolute filter compares the measurement with an absolute threshold value. Those filters are tested using horizontal speed measurements, i.e., measurements in the x-axis and in the y-axis.

value.name: Innovation Threshold - X
value.description: The current DVL x-axis measurement is discarded because the absolute difference between the value and the previous accepted DVL measurement with a given time window is above a configurable threshold.

value.name: Innovation Threshold - Y
value.description: The current DVL y-axis measurement is discarded because the absolute difference between the value and the previous accepted DVL measurement with a given time window is above a configurable threshold.

value.name: Absolute Threshold - X
value.description: The current DVL x-axis measurement is discarded because the the absolute value is above a configurable threshold.

value.name: Absolute Threshold - Y
value.description: The current DVL y-axis measurement is discarded because the the absolute value is above a configurable threshold.

field.name: Value
field.description: Value of the rejection. If it is an innovation rejection the value is the absolute difference between the previous accepted DVL measurement and the current one. If it is an absolute rejection the value is the current DVL measurement.

field.name: Timestep
field.description: Timestep of the rejection. The timestep is 0 for an absolute rejection since it is an instantaneous reading. For innovation rejection it is the time difference between the previous accepted DVL measurement and the current one.

message.name: LBL Beacon Position Estimate
message.description: LBL Beacon position estimate.

field.name: LBL Beacon Configuration
field.description: LBL Beacon configuration estimate.

field.name: North position
field.description: The North position offset of the NED field with respect to origin.

field.name: East position
field.description: The East position offset of the NED field with respect to origin.

field.name: North position variance
field.description: The North offset variance of the North/East/Down field with respect to LLH.

field.name: East position variance
field.description: The East offset variance of the North/East/Down field with respect to LLH.

field.name: Distance
field.description: Distance between current LBL Beacon position and filter estimation.

message.name: Alignment State
message.description: This message notifies the vehicle is ready for dead-reckoning missions.

field.name: State
field.description: Alignment State.

message.name: Desired Heading
message.description: Desired Heading angle reference value for the control layer.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired heading angle, relative to true north, in radians.

message.name: Desired Z
message.description: Desired Z reference value for the control layer.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired z reference in meters.

field.name: Z Units
field.description: Units of the z reference.

message.name: Desired Speed
message.description: Desired Speed reference value for the control layer.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired speed, in the scale specified by the "Speed Units" field.

field.name: Speed Units
field.description: Indicates the units used for the speed value.

message.name: Desired Roll
message.description: Desired Roll angle reference value for the control layer.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired roll angle.

message.name: Desired Pitch
message.description: Desired Pitch angle reference value for the control layer.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired pitch angle.

message.name: Desired Path
message.description:
Perform path control.
The path is specified by two WGS-84 waypoints, respective altitude / depth settings, optional loitering at the end point, and some control flags.
The start and end waypoints are defined by the specified end point fields ('end_{lat/lon/z}') plus:
1. the start waypoint fields ('start_{lat|lon|z}') if the 'START' flag (bit in 'flags' field) is set; or 2. the end point of the previous path recently tracked; or 3. the current location is the 'DIRECT' flag is set or if the tracker has been idle for some time.
Altitude and depth control can be performed as follows:
1. by default, the tracker will just transmit an altitude/depth reference value equal to 'end_z' to the appropriate controller; 2. if the 'NO_Z' flag is set no altitude/depth control will take place, hence they can be controlled independently; 3. if the '3DTRACK' flag is set, 3D-tracking will be done (if supported by the active controller).
Loitering can be specified at the end point with a certain radius ('lradius'), duration ('lduration'), and clockwise or counter-clockwise direction ('CCLOCKW' flag).

field.name: Path Reference
field.description: Unsigned integer reference for the scope of the desired path message. Path reference should only be set by a maneuver. Should be set to an always increasing reference at the time of dispatching this message. Lower level path controllers must inherit the same path reference sent by maneuver.

field.name: Start Point -- Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 latitude of start point. This will be ignored unless the 'START' flag is set.

field.name: Start Point -- WGS-84 Longitude
field.description: WGS-84 longitude of start point. This will be ignored unless the 'START' flag is set.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Altitude or depth of start point. This parameter will be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set, or if the 'START' flag is not set.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Units
field.description: Units of the start point's z reference.

field.name: End Point -- WGS84 Latitude
field.description: WGS-84 latitude of end point.

field.name: End Point -- WGS-84 Longitude
field.description: WGS-84 longitude of end point.

field.name: End Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Depth or altitude for the end point. This parameter will be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set.

field.name: End Point -- Z Units
field.description: Units of the end point's z reference.

field.name: Speed
field.description: Maneuver speed reference.

field.name: Speed Units
field.description: Speed units.

field.name: Loiter -- Radius
field.description: Radius for loitering at end point. Specify less or equal to 0 for no loitering.

field.name: Flags
field.description: Desired Path flags.

value.name: Start Point
value.description: Indicates that the start point specification is given, therefore it should be considered for tracking.

value.name: Direct
value.description: If start point is not given, ignore also the previous path's endpoint and take the start point to be the current vehicle location.

value.name: No Altitude/Depth control
value.description: Ignore altitude/depth setting and let them be controlled independently.

value.name: 3D Tracking
value.description: Perform 3D-tracking, i.e., consider the path formed in the XYZ plane taking into account both the 'start_z' and 'end_z' values.

value.name: Counter-Clockwise loiter
value.description: Indicates that loitering, if defined, should be done counter-clockwise. Clockwise loitering will apply otherwise.

value.name: Loiter from current position
value.description: Indicates that loitering, if defined, should be done from the current vehicle position. The end_lat and end_lon fields will be ignored.

value.name: Takeoff
value.description: Indicates that takeoff should be done before going to the end position.

value.name: Land
value.description: Indicates that the system should land at the end position.

message.name: Desired Control
message.description: Set the desired virtual forces and torques to be applied to the vehicle.

field.name: Force along the x axis
field.description: Force X along the vehicle's x axis.

field.name: Force along the y axis
field.description: Force Y along the vehicle's y axis.

field.name: Force along the z axis
field.description: Force Z along the vehicle's z axis.

field.name: Torque about the x axis
field.description: Torque K about the vehicle's x axis.

field.name: Torque about the y axis
field.description: Torque M about the vehicle's y axis.

field.name: Torque about the z axis
field.description: Torque N about the vehicle's z axis.

field.name: Flags
field.description: Desired Control flags.

value.name: Value of X is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field X has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of Y is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field Y has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of Z is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field Z has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of K is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field K has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of M is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field M has a meaningful value.

value.name: Value of N is meaningful
value.description: If enabled then field N has a meaningful value.

message.name: Desired Heading Rate
message.description: Desired Heading Rate speed reference value for the control layer.

field.name: Value
field.description: The value of the desired heading rate speed in radians per second.

message.name: Path Control State
message.description: Path control state issued by Path Controller.

field.name: Path Reference
field.description: Unsigned integer reference of the desired path message to which this PathControlState message refers to. Path reference should only be set by a maneuver, not by path controllers.

field.name: Start Point -- Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 latitude of start point.

field.name: Start Point -- WGS-84 Longitude
field.description: WGS-84 longitude of start point.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Altitude or depth of start point. This parameter will be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set, or if the 'START' flag is not set.

field.name: Start Point -- Z Units
field.description: Units of the start point's z reference.

field.name: End Point -- Latitude WGS-84
field.description: WGS-84 latitude of end point.

field.name: End Point -- WGS-84 Longitude
field.description: WGS-84 longitude of end point.

field.name: End Point -- Z Reference
field.description: Depth or altitude for the end point. This parameter should be ignored if the 'NO_Z' flag is set.

field.name: End Point -- Z Units
field.description: Units of the end point's z reference.

field.name: Loiter -- Radius
field.description: Radius for loitering at end point. Will be 0 if no loitering is active.

field.name: Flags
field.description: Path control state flags.

value.name: Near Endpoint
value.description: Set if near the target endpoint.

value.name: Loitering
value.description: Set if loitering.

value.name: No Altitude/Depth control
value.description: Altitude/depth being controlled independently.

value.name: 3D Tracking
value.description: 3D-tracking is active.

value.name: Counter-Clockwise loiter
value.description: Indicates that loitering, if active, is being done counter-clockwise. Otherwise, clockwise loitering should be assumed.

field.name: Along Track Position
field.description: Along-Track position value.

field.name: Cross Track Position
field.description: Cross-Track position value.

field.name: Vertical Track Position
field.description: Vertical-Track position value.

field.name: Along Track Velocity
field.description: Along-Track velocity value.

field.name: Cross Track Velocity
field.description: Cross-Track velocity value.

field.name: Vertical Track Velocity
field.description: Vertical-Track velocity value.

field.name: Course Error
field.description: Course error value.

field.name: Estimated Time to Arrival (ETA)
field.description: Estimated time to reach target waypoint. The value will be 65535 if the time is unknown or undefined, and 0 when loitering.

message.name: Allocated Control Torques
message.description: Control torques allocated to the actuators.

field.name: Torque about the x axis
field.description: Torque K about the vehicle's x axis.

field.name: Torque about the y axis
field.description: Torque M about the vehicle's y axis.

field.name: Torque about the x axis
field.description: Torque N about the vehicle's z axis.

message.name: Control Parcel
message.description: Report of PID control parcels.

field.name: Proportional Parcel
field.description: Proportional parcel value.

field.name: Integrative Parcel
field.description: Integral parcel value.

field.name: Derivative Parcel
field.description: Derivative parcel value.

field.name: Anti-Windup Parcel
field.description: Anti-windup parcel value.

message.name: Brake
message.description: Brake the vehicle in some way, i. e., reduce forward speed.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Brake operation.

value.name: Stop Braking
value.description: Stop braking procedures.

value.name: Start Braking
value.description: Start braking procedures.

value.name: Revert Actuation
value.description: Revert Actuation.

message.name: Vehicle State
message.description:
This message summarizes the overall state of the vehicle. It can contains information regarding:
- The overall operation mode. - Any error conditions. - Current maneuver execution. - Active control loops.

field.name: Operation Mode
field.description: The overall operation mode.

value.name: Service
value.description: Ready to service requests.

value.name: Calibration
value.description: Ongoing vehicle calibration.

value.name: Error
value.description: Errors are set.

value.name: Maneuver
value.description: A maneuver is executing.

value.name: External Control
value.description: External control is active.

value.name: Boot
value.description: Booting system.

field.name: Errors -- Count
field.description: Error count for monitored entitites.

field.name: Errors -- Entities
field.description: The monitored entities with error conditions. This is a comma separated list of entity names.

field.name: Maneuver -- Type
field.description: Type of maneuver being executed, when in MANEUVER mode. The value is the IMC serialization ID of the corresponding maneuver.

field.name: Maneuver -- Start Time
field.description: Start time of maneuver being executed (Epoch time), when in MANEUVER mode.

field.name: Maneuver -- ETA
field.description: Estimated time for maneuver completion. The value will be 65535 if the time is unknown or undefined.

field.name: Control Loops
field.description: Enabled control loops.

field.name: Last Error -- Description
field.description: Description of last error.

field.name: Last Error -- Time
field.description: Time of last error (Epoch time).

message.name: Vehicle Command
message.description: Vehicle command.

field.name: Request ID
field.description: Request ID

field.name: Command
field.description: The type of command/action to be performed

value.name: Execute Maneuver
value.description: Execute the maneuver specified in 'maneuver' field.

value.name: Stop Maneuver
value.description: Stop 'maneuver' being executed.

value.name: Start Calibration
value.description: Start calibrating vehicle.

value.name: Stop Calibration
value.description: Stop calibrating vehicle.

field.name: Maneuver
field.description: Maneuver to be executed (for 'EXEC_MANEUVER' command)

field.name: Calibration Time
field.description: Amount of time to calibrate

field.name: Info
field.description: Complementary human-readable information for replies.

message.name: Monitor Entity State
message.description: Controls monitoring of entity states in the vehicle.

field.name: Command
field.description: Command.

field.name: Entity Names
field.description: Comma separated list of entity names.

field.name: Entities monitored - Count
field.description: Number of entitities being monitored.

field.name: Entities monitored - Names
field.description: Comma separated list of all entity names being monitored.

field.name: Entities with errors - Count
field.description: Number of entitities with non-critical errors.

field.name: Entities with errors - Names
field.description: Comma separated list of all entity names with non-critical errors.

field.name: Entities with critical errors - Count
field.description: Number of entitities with critical errors.

field.name: Entities with critical errors - Names
field.description: Comma separated list of all entity names with critical errors.

field.name: Last Error -- Description
field.description: Description of last error.

field.name: Last Error -- Time
field.description: Time of last error (Epoch time).

message.name: Operational Limits
message.description: Definition of operational limits.

message.name: Get Operational Limits
message.description: Command to obtain the operational limits in use by the vehicle.

message.name: Calibration
message.description: Initiate overall calibration of a vehicle.

field.name: Duration
field.description: Duration of calibration.

message.name: Control Loops
message.description: Enable or disable control loops.

field.name: Control Loop Mask
field.description: Control loop mask.

field.name: Scope Time Reference
field.description: Unsigned integer reference for the scope of the control loop message. Scope reference should only be set by a maneuver. Should be set to an always increasing reference at the time of dispatching this message. Lower level controllers must inherit the same scope reference sent by maneuver. This same scope reference must be sent down to lower control layers.

message.name: Vehicle Medium
message.description: Detect current vehicle medium.

field.name: Medium
field.description: Current medium.

value.name: Ground
value.description: Vehicle is on the ground

value.name: Air
value.description: Vehicle is airborne

value.name: Water
value.description: Vehicle is at water surface

value.name: Underwater
value.description: Vehicle is underwater

value.name: Unknown
value.description: Vehicle medium is unknown

message.name: Collision
message.description: Detected collision.

field.name: Collision value
field.description: Estimated collision acceleration value.

field.name: Type
field.description: Collision flags.

value.name: X-axis
value.description: Collision detected in the x-axis

value.name: Y-axis
value.description: Collision detected in the y-axis

value.name: Z-axis
value.description: Collision detected in the z-axis

value.name: Impact
value.description: Sudden impact detected

message.name: Report Control
message.description: This message is sent to trigger reports to a destination system.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Operation to perform.

value.name: Request Start of Reports
value.description: Request a system to periodically send reports through 'interface'. The destination system will reply with a STARTED command. Periodicity will be defined by the field 'period'. If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

value.name: Report Started
value.description: The destination system will reply a message with this operation everytime a report is successfully started. The periodicity of reports is indicated in the field 'period' while the communication interface to be used is described in field 'interface'. If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

value.name: Request Stop of Reports
value.description: Request a system to stop dispatching reports through a given communication interface described in 'interface'. The destination system will reply with a STOPPED command. If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

value.name: Report Stopped
value.description: The destination system will reply a message with this operation everytime a scheduled report is successfully stopped in a defined communication interface. If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

value.name: Request Single Reports
value.description: Request a system to issue a single report in a defined communication interface. The destination system will reply with a REPORT_ISSUED command. If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

value.name: Single Report Sent
value.description: The destination system will reply a single report request with this operation.If applicable, the destination address is defined in field 'dst'.

field.name: Communication Interface
field.description: Communication interface to be used for reports.

value.name: Acoustic
value.description: Use acoustic communications

value.name: Satellite
value.description: Use satellite communications

value.name: GSM
value.description: Use Global System for Mobile Communications

value.name: Mobile
value.description: Use mobile networks

field.name: Period
field.description: Desired periodicity for scheduled reports.

field.name: Destination System
field.description: Destination Address to be filled where applicable. It should be interpreted differently depending on communication interface.

message.name: Abort
message.description: Stops any executing actions and put the system in a standby mode.

message.name: Plan Specification
message.description:
Identity and description of a plan's general parameters, associated with plan loading (i.e. load plan command in *PlanCommand*).
A plan specification is defined by a plan identifier, a set of maneuver specifications and a start maneuver from that set.
See the :ref:`PlanManeuver` message for details on maneuver specification.

field.name: Plan ID
field.description: The plan's identifier.

field.name: Plan Description
field.description: Verbose text description of plan.

field.name: Namespace
field.description: Namespace for plan variables.

field.name: Plan Variables
field.description: Plan variables.

field.name: Starting maneuver
field.description: Indicates the id of the starting maneuver for this plan.

field.name: Maneuvers
field.description: List of maneuver specifications.

field.name: Transitions
field.description: List of maneuver specifications.

field.name: Start Actions
field.description: Contains an optionally defined 'MessageList' for actions fired on plan activation.

field.name: End Actions
field.description: Contains an optionally defined 'MessageList' for actions fired on plan termination.

message.name: Plan Maneuver
message.description: Named plan maneuver.

field.name: Maneuver ID
field.description: The maneuver ID.

field.name: Maneuver Specification
field.description: The maneuver specification.

field.name: Start Actions
field.description: Contains an optionally defined 'MessageList' for actions fired on plan activation.

field.name: End Actions
field.description: Contains an optionally defined 'MessageList' for actions fired on plan termination.

message.name: Plan Transition
message.description: Describes a plan transition within a plan specification. A transition states the vehicle conditions that must be met to signal the transition, the maneuver that should be started as a result, and an optional set of actions triggered by the transition.

field.name: Source
field.description: Comma separated list of maneuver IDs, or the special value '.' to identify a global plan transition.

field.name: Destination Maneuver Name
field.description: Target maneuver name. If it equals the special value '_done_' then plan should terminate with a success status. If it equals the special value '_error_' then the plan should terminate with an error status.

field.name: Transition conditions
field.description: Comma separated list of conditions for transition. Each condition identifier corresponds to a known predicate which is interpreted and tested internally by the vehicle.

field.name: Transition actions
field.description: Messages processed when the transition is triggered.

message.name: Plan DB
message.description: Request/reply to plan database.

field.name: Type
field.description: Indicates if the message is a request, or a reply to a previous request.

field.name: Operation
field.description:
Indicates the operation affecting the DB.
The operation may relate to a single plan or the entire plan DB. For each request, a plan DB may reply with any number of 'in progress' replies followed by a success or a failure reply.
The 'op', 'request_id' and 'plan_id' fields of a request will be echoed in one or more responses to that request. The operation at stake also determines a certain type of the 'arg' field, and whether or not the 'plan_id' field needs to be set.

value.name: Set Plan
value.description: Set a plan in the DB. The 'plan_id' field identifies the plan, and a pre-existing plan with the same identifier, if any will be overwritten. For requests, the 'arg' field must contain a 'PlanSpecification' message.

value.name: Delete Plan
value.description: Delete a plan from the DB. The 'plan_id' field identifies the plan to delete.

value.name: Get Plan
value.description: Get a plan stored in the DB.The 'plan_id' field identifies the plan. Successful replies will yield a 'PlanSpecification' message in the 'arg' field.

value.name: Get Plan Info
value.description: Get DB state for a stored plan. The 'plan_id' field identifies the plan. Successful replies will yield a 'PlanDBInformation' message in the 'arg' field.

value.name: Clear Database
value.description: Clear the entire DB.

value.name: Get Database State (Simple)
value.description: Get state of the entire DB. Successful replies will yield a 'PlanDBState' message in the 'arg' field but without individual plan information (in the 'plans_info' field of 'PlanDBState').

value.name: Get Database State (Detailed)
value.description: Get detailed state of the entire DB. Successful replies will yield a 'PlanDBState' message in the 'arg' field with individual plan information (in the 'plans_info' field of 'PlanDBState').

value.name: Boot Notification
value.description: PlanDB replies of this type are sent automatically during bootstrap.

field.name: Request ID
field.description: Request ID. This may be used by interfacing modules, e.g. using sequence counters, to annotate requests and appropriately identify replies

field.name: Plan ID
field.description: Plan identifier for the operation, if one is required.

field.name: Argument
field.description: Request or reply argument.

field.name: Complementary Information
field.description: Human-readable complementary information. For example this may be used to detail reasons for failure, or to report in-progress information.

message.name: Plan DB State
message.description: Characterizes the state of the entire plan database.

field.name: Plan -- Count
field.description: Number of stored plans.

field.name: Plan -- Size of all plans
field.description: Size of all plans.The value equals the sum of the IMC payload sizes for 'PlanSpecification' stored in the DB.

field.name: Last Change -- Time
field.description: Time of last change (Epoch time).

field.name: Last Change -- Source Address
field.description: IMC address for source of last DB change.

field.name: Last Change -- Source Name
field.description: IMC node name for source of last DB change.

field.name: MD5
field.description: MD5 database verification code. The MD5 hash sum is computed over the stream formed by the MD5 of all plans, ordered by plan id, in compliance with RFC 1321.

field.name: Plan info
field.description: Individual information for plans.

field.name: Plan ID
field.description: Plan identifier.

field.name: Plan Size
field.description: Plan size. The value equals the IMC message payload of the associated 'PlanSpecification' message in bytes.

field.name: Last Changed -- Time
field.description: Time of last change to the plan (Epoch time).

field.name: Last Change -- Source Address
field.description: IMC address for source of last change to the plan.

field.name: Last Change -- Source Name
field.description: IMC node name for source of last change to the plan.

field.name: MD5
field.description: MD5 plan verification code. The value is calculated over the message payload of the 'PlanSpecification', in compliance with RFC 1321.

message.name: Plan Control
message.description: Plan control request/reply.

field.name: Type
field.description: Indicates if the message is a request or a reply to a previous request. The *op*, *request_id* and *plan_id* fields of a request will be echoed in one or more responses to that request.

field.name: Operation
field.description: Plan control operation.

value.name: Start Plan
value.description:
Start plan identified by *plan_id* field. The command will try to load the corresponding plan if none is loaded, and in that case will follow the same discipline as the *LOAD* command.
If the message in *arg* is a :ref:`Maneuver`, a single-maneuver plan will be generated and executed.
This will override any current plan being executed.

value.name: Stop Plan
value.description: Stop current plan being executed if any.

value.name: Load Plan
value.description: Load Plan. If a :ref:`PlanSpecification` is given with the request in the *data* field, then that plan is used and stored in the Plan DB. Otherwise, the plan is loaded from the Plan DB.

value.name: Get Plan
value.description: Get loaded plan. For a successful reply, the *data* field will contain the :ref:`PlanSpecification` message that corresponds to the currently loaded plan.

field.name: Request ID
field.description: Request ID. This may be used by interfacing modules e.g. using sequence counters. to annotate requests and appropriately identify replies.

field.name: Plan Identifier
field.description: The identifier for the plan to be stopped / started / loaded / retrieved according to the command requested (*op* field).

value.name: Calibrate Vehicle
value.description: Perform vehicle calibration.

value.name: Ignore Errors
value.description: Execute current plan while ignoring some errors that might be active.

field.name: Request/Reply Argument
field.description: Complementary message argument for requests/replies.

field.name: Complementary Info
field.description: Complementary human-readable information. This is used in association to replies.

message.name: Plan Control State
message.description: State of plan control.

field.name: State
field.description: Describes overall state.

value.name: Blocked
value.description: Plan execution is blocked e.g., due to a vehicle error, or if no plan is loaded.

value.name: Ready
value.description: Ready to start plan execution.

value.name: Initializing
value.description: Initializing plan for execution.

value.name: Executing
value.description: Executing plan.

field.name: Plan -- ID
field.description: Identifier of plan currently loaded.

field.name: Plan -- ETA
field.description: Current plan estimated time to completion. The value will be -1 if the time is unknown or undefined.

field.name: Plan -- Progress
field.description: Current plan estimated progress in percent. The value will be negative if unknown or undefined.

field.name: Maneuver -- ID
field.description: Current node ID, when executing a plan.

field.name: Maneuver -- Type
field.description: Type of maneuver being executed (IMC serialization id), when executing a plan.

field.name: Maneuver -- ETA
field.description: Current node estimated time to completion, when executing a plan. The value will be -1 if the time is unknown or undefined.

field.name: Last Plan Outcome
field.description: Outcome of the last executed plan.

value.name: None
value.description: Unknown or not filled.

value.name: Success
value.description: Last plan execution was successful.

value.name: Failure
value.description: Last plan execution was a failure.

message.name: Plan Variable
message.description: A plan variable.

message.name: Plan Generation
message.description: This message is used to order the generation of plans based on id and set of parameters.

value.name: Generate
value.description: Generate the plan and store it in the PlanDB.

value.name: Execute
value.description: Generate (storing it in the PlanDB) and execute it immediately.

value.name: Request
value.description: Request the execution of this command.

value.name: Error
value.description: Some error has occurred while executing the command. The error can be found in the 'params' tuplelist (under the key 'error').

value.name: Success
value.description: The requested command was executed successfully.

field.name: Plan Identifier
field.description: The name of the plan to be generated.

field.name: Parameters
field.description: An optional list of parameters to be used by the plan generation module.

field.name: Plan Identifier
field.description: The name of the plan to be generated.

field.name: Type
field.description: Type of plan statistics, if they are launched before, during or after the plan execution.

value.name: Basic Plan
value.description: Basic plan, meaning it is Linear, Finite and Noncyclic.

value.name: Nonlinear
value.description: Plan is nonlinear.

value.name: Infinite
value.description: Plan is infinite in duration.

value.name: Cyclical
value.description: Plan is cyclical.

value.name: All
value.description: All properties checked.

field.name: Durations
field.description: Maneuver and plan duration statistics in seconds, for example: Total=1000,Goto1=20,Rows=980

field.name: Distances
field.description: Distances travelled in meters in each maneuver and/or total: Total=2000,Rows=1800,Elevator=200

field.name: Actions
field.description: List of components active by plan actions during the plan and time active in seconds: Sidescan=100,Camera Module=150

field.name: Fuel
field.description: Amount of fuel spent, in battery percentage, by different parcels (if applicable): Total=35,Hotel=5,Payload=10,Motion=20,IMU=0

message.name: CCU Event
message.description: This message is used to signal events among running CCUs.

value.name: The sender is now teleoperating the vehicle
The sender stopped teleoperating the vehicle

message.name: Vehicle Links
message.description: This message is sent by the TREX task which gives further information to a TREX instance about connected IMC nodes

field.name: Local Name
field.description: The name of the vehicle being controlled

field.name: Active Links
field.description: A list of Announce messages with last announces heard

message.name: TREX Operation
message.description: This message is used to control TREX execution

field.name: Goal Id
field.description: The id of the goal, if applicable (OP == POST_GOAL || OP == RECALL_GOAL)

field.name: Token
field.description: Goal / observation to post, if applicable (OP == POST_GOAL || OP == POST_TOKEN)

field.name: Attribute Name
field.description: Name of this attribute.

field.name: Minimum
field.description: Lower bound of this interval. Empty text means no bound.

field.name: Maximum
field.description: Upper bound of this interval. Empty text means no bound.

message.name: I/O Event
message.description: Notification of an I/O event.

field.name: Type
field.description: Event type.

field.name: Error Message
field.description: Human-readable error message.

message.name: Aborted
message.description: This message signals that an :ref:`Abort` message was received and acted upon.

message.name: Tachograph
message.description: This messages is used to record system activity parameters. These parameters are mainly used for used for maintenance purposes.

field.name: Last Service Timestamp
field.description: The time when the last service was performed. The number of seconds is represented in Universal Coordinated Time (UCT) in seconds since Jan 1, 1970.

field.name: Time - Next Service
field.description: Amount of time until the next recommended service.

field.name: Time Motor - Next Service
field.description: Amount of time the motor can run until the next recommended service.

field.name: Time Idle - Ground
field.description: Amount of time the system spent idle on the ground.

field.name: Time Idle - Air
field.description: Amount of time the system spent idle in the air.

field.name: Time Idle - Water
field.description: Amount of time the system spent idle on the water (not submerged).

field.name: Time Idle - Underwater
field.description: Amount of time the system spent idle underwater.

field.name: Time Idle - Unknown
field.description: Amount of time the system spent idle in an unknown medium.

field.name: Time Motor - Ground
field.description: Amount of time the system spent on the ground with the motor running.

field.name: Time Motor - Air
field.description: Amount of time the system spent in the air with the motor running.

field.name: Time Motor - Water
field.description: Amount of time the system spent on the water (not submerged) with the motor running.

field.name: Time Motor - Underwater
field.description: Amount of time the system spent underwater with the motor running.

field.name: Time Motor - Unknown
field.description: Amount of time the system spent in an unknown medium with the motor running.

field.name: Recorded RPMs - Minimum
field.description: The minimum recorded RPM value.

field.name: Recorded RPMs - Maximum
field.description: The maximum recorded RPM value.

field.name: Recorded Depth - Maximum
field.description: The maximum recorded depth value.
